titlepage.titleproper: Guide to the Rob Walker Papers
titlepage.publisher:
Department of Special Collections and University Archives
Stanford University Libraries
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © 2008 The Board of Trustees of Stanford University. All rights reserved.

did.head: Descriptive Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: Stanford University. Libraries. Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives.

did.abstract: The collection contains presentation slides, reports, sales material, and other documentation from from LSI Logic Corp.; articles and papers given by Rob Walker; documents from Fairchild Semiconductor; specifications from Lawrence Livermore Laboratories; and, documentation from Philco Corp.
did.langmaterial: Languages represented in the collection: English

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research; materials must be requested at least 24 hours in advance of intended use.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Rob Walker papers, M0742. Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biography / Administrative History
bioghist.p: Walker is an ASIC (Application specific integrated circuits) consultant and founder of LSI Logic. He is also the author of SILICON DESTINY: THE STORY OF ASIC AND LSI LOGIC CORPORATIONS, CMC Publications (Milpitas, Calif.), 1993.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The collection contains manuals, binders of research materials, documents, and minutes of meetings from Fairchild Semiconductor; materials documenting Walker's career at LSI Logic, including correspondence, presentation slides, reports, publications put out by the Corporate Communications Department, as well as articles and papers by Rob Walker and by others; technical data from Walker's research at Lawrence Livermore Laboratories in the 1960's; technical manuals, marketing materials, and other documents accumulated during Walker's years at Philco Corp.; and an audiocassette of a 1995 interview with Walker.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged into five series: Series 1: Fairchild Semiconductor materials; Series 2: LSI Logic Corp. materials; Series 3: Lawrence Livermore Laboratory materials; Series 4: Philco Corp. materials; and Series 5: Audiovisual materials.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.

controlaccess.head: Subjects
controlaccess.corpname: Fairchild Camera and Instrument Corporation. Fairchild Semiconductor Division.
controlaccess.subject: Application specific integrated circuits.
Computer industry.
Microelectronics industry--California--Santa Clara County.

controlaccess.head: Other Index Terms Related to this Collection
controlaccess.title: The rise of the silicon architect companies : manuscript draft.

scopecontent.head: Series Scope and Content Summary
scopecontent.p: This series contains manuals, binders of research materials and documents, articles and papers by Rob Walker, and minutes of Fairchild meetings.

scopecontent.head: Series Scope and Content Summary
scopecontent.p: This series contains materials documenting Rob Walker's career at LSI Logic, and includes correspondence, presentation slides, reports, publications put out by the Corporate Communications Department, as well as articles and papers by Rob Walker and by others.

scopecontent.head: Subseries Scope and Content Summary
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains correspondence and memos to and from Rob Walker relating to LSI Logic's project, products, and goals.

did.unittitle: Correspondence re: litigation -- Lear Siegler, Inc. vs. LSI Logic Corp., 1982 Jan. 12

scopecontent.p: Includes extensive memos on LSI's Modular Design Environment.

scopecontent.head: Subseries Scope and Content Summary
scopecontent.p: This series is almost entirely comprised of photocopies of slide cells for talks that Rob Walker gave while at LSI Logic to both internal and external audiences.

scopecontent.head: Series Scope and Content Summary
scopecontent.p: This series contains technical manuals, marketing materials, and other documents generated by Philco Corp. It also contains a copy of the manuscript and the final published version of an article written by Rob Walker entitled: "A building block approach to digital-to-analog convertors".
